page.title: 06The Post Office, Wray
page.content: Wray Post Office deals with all the mail. The postman gets up at 6 a.m. to prepare the mail for delivery. He sorts out the letters and packages by name, address and postcode. Then he puts it into a Royal Mail bag and delivers it around the village. He arrives back about 9 a.m. and works in the Post Office selling stamps, postal orders, weighing parcels and keeping the Giro Bank in order. Another postman in a Royal Mail van delivers mail outside the village. At midday, and again at 5.40 p.m., a postman arrives in a van to collect mail posted and franked in Wray, and take it to Lancaster for sorting. Another vital means of communication is the telephone. 108 people in Wray have telephones, and there is one public telephone box.
